title: Dragon is a Descendant of the Shandia
theory: Monkey D. Dragon may be a descendant of the Shandia people, potentially from Kalgara's bloodline. Evidence includes Dragon's distinctive tattoos that closely resemble those worn by Kalgara and Wyper - unique markings not commonly seen on other One Piece characters. This would explain Dragon's fierce opposition to the World Government, as the Shandia were victims of displacement and oppression. The theory suggests Dragon's revolutionary ideology may be rooted in inherited memories of injustice against his ancestors.

title: Skypiea Foreshadows the Origin of Devil Fruits
theory: The Skypiea Arc, particularly the Noland-Kalgara flashback, contains crucial foreshadowing about the origin of Devil Fruits. The story mentions ancient gods (Sun God, Earth God, Rain God, Forest God) that parallel the Nika revelation and other godly powers. The theory suggests that Devil Fruits originated from Sky Islands and are connected to ancient civilizations like Shandora. The 'tree' symbolism throughout Skypiea (Tree Fever, Forest of Embodiment, trees housing souls) may hint at Devil Fruits growing from special trees.

title: The Golden Bell Will Ring Again for Luffy's Coronation
theory: Just as Luffy rings the Golden Bell to fulfill Noland and Kalgara's promise (Episode 195), the bell will ring again at the end of the series when Luffy becomes Pirate King or achieves his ultimate dream. This would create a full-circle moment connecting the themes of inherited will, fulfilled promises, and dreams across the entire series. Some theorists suggest Cricket (Noland's descendant) will be present to witness this final ringing, completing his family's 400-year quest.

title: Noland's Execution Parallels Future Executions
theory: Mont Blanc Noland's execution for telling an 'impossible' truth that society refused to believe establishes a pattern that will repeat with other major characters. Just as Noland was executed for claiming the City of Gold existed, other characters who reveal world-shaking truths (like the true history of the Void Century) may face similar fates. The theory suggests this is Oda's commentary on how societies suppress uncomfortable truths by executing truth-tellers.

title: The Knock Up Stream and Ancient Weapons Connection
theory: The Knock Up Stream that sent Jaya to the sky may not be entirely natural. Some theorists propose it could be connected to Ancient Weapons or ancient technology from the Void Century. The theory suggests that Shandora was deliberately sent to the sky to hide it or protect it from the World Government, and the 'natural phenomenon' explanation is incomplete. This would explain why such a convenient event occurred right when it did.
